intro: Elionurus nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's elionurus, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Elionurus nuttallii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
